meanings.sent1: He pell the door closed in anger.
meanings.sent2: She pell the ball with all her might.
meanings.sent3: The chef pell the dough to make it fluffy.
meanings.sent4: The storm pell the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The hammer pell the nail into the wood effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A fine cloth made from wool or hair
meanings.sent1: She wore a soft pell scarf to keep warm.
meanings.sent2: The tailor used pell to create a beautiful dress.
meanings.sent3: The baby snuggled into the cozy pell blanket.
meanings.sent4: The king's robe was made of the finest pell.
meanings.sent5: The pell fabric felt luxurious against her skin.

meanings.definition: A small, round seed of a leguminous plant
meanings.sent1: She planted the pell in neat rows in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The cook added pell to the soup for extra protein.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel buried the pell in the ground for winter.
meanings.sent4: The farmer harvested the ripe pell from the plants.
meanings.sent5: The pell sprouted into a healthy plant in the sunlight.
